intro: Discophora panamensis, commonly known as the Panamanian discophora, is a species of flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in tropical and subtropical environments, often found in wetlands and along riverbanks. Discophora panamensis plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators and habitat for small organisms.
